intro: Zacintha pendula, commonly known as the hanging bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that hang from slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers range in color from white to pale blue, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Zacintha pendula is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
